meanings.definition: To completely destroy or level to the ground.
meanings.sent1: The bulldozer will raze the old building to make space for a new park.
meanings.sent2: The army planned to raze the enemy's fortifications to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon tried to raze the carefully arranged picnic by knocking over the food.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fierce winds seemed to raze everything in their path, leaving only destruction behind.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire's uncontrollable flames threatened to raze the entire forest to ashes.

meanings.sent1: The carpenter needed to raze a thin layer off the wood to make it smooth.
meanings.sent2: She used a sharp blade to raze the excess clay from the pottery she was crafting.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to raze a burnt layer from the toast before serving it to the customer.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor carefully razed small imperfections from the marble statue to perfect its appearance.
meanings.sent5: The gardener decided to raze the overgrown grass to create a neat and tidy lawn.
